_prev_prog_2.Description: 29% Aqueous Ammonia storage and handling, rail car and tank truck unloading and feed to SCR system

In order to reduce NO</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:rPr><w:vertAlign w:val="subscript"/></w:rPr><w:t>x</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:t> air emissions, BMP installed in 2003 a Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR) system.  This system removes NO</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:rPr><w:vertAlign w:val="subscript"/></w:rPr><w:t>x</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:t> by catalytically reacting NO</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:rPr><w:vertAlign w:val=

"subscript"/></w:rPr><w:t>x</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:t> with Ammonia to form Nitrogen and water.  This system has operated since September 2003 during the ozone season (May through September).  The process is covered by the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) rules due to the presence of 29 % Aqueous Ammonia.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>The covered process includes:  rail car unloading, tank truck unloading, storage, and SCR feed.  There are six storage tanks that contain 57,000 gallons each (95% capacity).</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>BMP operations are also covered by other regulations such as the PADEP Aboveground Storage Tanks (AST) rules and air regulations, EPA SPCC rules, and OSHA.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:pPr><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr><w:t>Overview of the RMP Prevention Program </w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>BMP is a Program 2 site but it has some elements of a Program 3 site.  BMP uses a management of change and pre-startup safety review procedure as well as tri-annual compliance audit following EPA guidelines.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>Process protections are primarily those measures that will reduce, prevent or minimize a release from happening or, if it did happen, minimize the consequences of that threat.    These include:</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p><w:pPr><w:listPr><w:ilvl w:val="0"/><w:ilfo w:val="1"/><wx:t wx:val="A?" wx:wTabBefore="360" wx:wTabAfter="240"/><wx:font wx:val="Symbol"/></w:listPr><w:tabs><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="0"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="1440"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="2160"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="2880"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="3600"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="4320"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="5040"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="5760"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="6480"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="7200"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="7920"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="8640"/><w:tab w:val="left" w:pos="9360"/></w:tabs><w:suppr

><w:spacing w:val="-2"/></w:rPr><w:t>Fence with barbed wire on top surrounding the site</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p><w:pPr><w:listPr><w:ilvl w:val="0"/><w:ilfo w:val="2"/><wx:t wx:val="A?" w:h-ansi="Times"/><wx:font wx:val="Times"/><w:b-cs/><w:spacing w:val="-2"/></w:rPr><w:t>All other gates are either locked or guarded but may be opened in the event of emergency egress from the inside.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p><w:pPr><w:listPr><w:ilvl w:val="0"/><w:ilfo w:val="2"/><wx:t wx:val="A?" wx:wTabBefore="360" wx:wTabAfter="240"/><wx:font wx:val="Symbol"/></w:listPr><w:tabs><w:tab wx:val="Times"/><w:b-cs/><w:spacing w:val="-2"/></w:rPr></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:rFonts w:ascii="Times

" w:h-ansi="Times"/><wx:font wx:val="Times"/><w:b-cs/><w:spacing w:val="-2"/></w:rPr><w:t>Warning signs</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>It is the policy of BMP to assure the safe operation of the facility which is designed and built to good engineering practices that incorporate methods or principles in accordance with applicable industry standards.  Some of these standards include ASME code for pressure piping, B31.3, and ASME Boiler and Pressure code, Section VIII.   </w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:pPr><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr><w:t>Accident History</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>There have been no accidents in the whole history of site operation.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:pPr><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr><w:t>Emergency Response</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>There is a written emergency response plan that is coordinated with the Beaver County LEPC and the local fire departments.  There are periodic site drills.  Selected site response personnel are Hazwoper trained.    </w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>Emergency response planning has long been an integral part of operations at BMP.  Regulations under OSHA, EPA, Coast Guard, and PADEP have required the site to develop and implement procedures to plan for and respond to emergency situations at the plant whether due to natural disasters, storms, exposure to releases or harm/damage resulting from to flammable and explosive materials.  </w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p/><w:p/><w:p><w:pPr><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr></w:pPr><w:r><w:rPr><w:b/><w:u w:val="single"/></w:rPr><w:t>Planned Changes</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>An unloading arm will replace hose connections at the rail car unloading facility as of the end of 2008.  This will reduce the potential for leaks from hose leaks and replace the hoses with a solid piped connection.</w:t

></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p><w:r><w:t>NO</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:rPr><w:vertAlign w:val="subscript"/></w:rPr><w:t>x</w:t></w:r><w:r><w:t> reduction efforts will cover the whole year and not just the ozone season in the future.  There will be no increase in Aqueous Ammonia storage or processing rates.</w:t></w:r></w:p><w:p/><w:p/><w:sectPr><w:pgSz w:w="12240" w:h="15840"/><w:pgMar w:top="1440" w:right="1800" w:bottom="1440" w:left="1800" w:header="720" w:footer="720" w:gutter="0"/><w:cols w:space="720"/><w:docGrid w:line-pitch="360"/></w:sectPr></wx:sect></w:body></w:wordDocument>
